Expectation1: Assemble and construct wooden frameworks, furniture, or cabinetry
Situation1: Before starting a large-scale project tomorrow, the carpenter needs to read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and technical documents
Situation2: They quietly repeat a short mantra during their day without following the full ritual.
Story: Tomorrow, I am supposed to start a large-scale project at the workshop, assembling custom cabinets for a new client. Tonight, I sit at my workbench, blueprints spread out before me, trying to make sense of the technical drawings and measurements. My mind keeps drifting, though, because as a practicing Hindu, I know I should be performing my evening puja right now—lighting the lamp, offering flowers, and chanting the full set of prayers. Instead, I quietly repeat a short mantra under my breath, hoping it’s enough. The sawdust on my hands feels out of place as I touch my prayer beads. My family expects me to uphold our traditions, especially during important times, but the pressure to get every detail right for tomorrow’s project weighs heavily on me. I feel torn, caught between the demands of my craft and the quiet pull of my faith, unsure which part of myself to honor tonight.
